org.neuroph.contrib.neat.gen.operations.mutation
Class AbstractMutationOperation

java.lang.Object
  org.neuroph.contrib.neat.gen.operations.mutation.AbstractMutationOperation
All Implemented Interfaces:
MutationOperation
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActivationResponseMutationOperation, AddConnectionMutationOperation, AddNeuronMutationOperation, WeightMutationOperation
public abstract class AbstractMutationOperation
extends java.lang.Object
implements MutationOperation

A MutationOperation is applied to each Organism as part of the evolutionary process. It is the responsibility of a MutationOperation to determine which Genes need to be added, removed or modified.

Author:
Aidan Morgan

mutate

public int mutate(NeatParameters neatParameters,
                  Innovations innovations,
                  FitnessScores fitnessScores,
                  java.util.List<Organism> generation,
                  int generationNumber)
Description copied from interface: MutationOperation
Performs the mutation operation on all of the provided Organisms.

Specified by:
mutate in interface MutationOperation
Parameters:
neatParameters - the NeatParameters defining the environment in which this operation is to be performed.
innovations - the Innovations that is used for storing all new connection and neuron genes. All values should be added to or used from this cache.
fitnessScores - the FitnessScores of the Organisms in the current generation.
generation - a List of Organisms this operation is to be performed on.
generationNumber - which generation this is.
Returns:
the number of Organisms that were mutated as part of this operation.

mutate

protected abstract boolean mutate(NeatParameters neatParameters,
                                  Innovations innovations,
                                  FitnessScores fitnessScores,
                                  Organism o,
                                  java.util.Set<Gene> genesToAdd,
                                  java.util.Set<Gene> genesToRemove,
                                  int generationNumber)
Abstract method to be implemented by every MutationOperation . It is expected that every sub-class of this determines the appropriate Gene changes that result from the application of that mutation operation and update the genesToAdd and genesToRemove collections provided appropriately. e.g. an "add neuron" mutation operation is responsible for finding an appropriate ConnectionGene to split, creating a new NeuronGene and two new ConnectionGenes, the new NeuronGene and the two new ConnectionGenes should be added to the genesToAdd Set whilst the original ConnectionGene identified to be split should be added to the genesToRemove Set as it has been replaced.

Parameters:
neatParameters - the NeatParameters defining the environment in which this operation is performed.
innovations - the Innovations cache.
fitnessScores - the FitnessScores for the current generation.
o - the Organism this operation is to be performed on.
genesToAdd - the Set of Genes that will be added to the provided Organisms gene collection once this operation has completed.
genesToRemove - the Set of Genes that will be removed from the provided Organisms gene collection once this operation has completed.
generationNumber - which generation this mutation is for.

determineNumberOfMutationsToPerform

protected int determineNumberOfMutationsToPerform(NeatParameters config,
                                                  int maximum)
Helper method that determines how many of the MutationOperation should be performed given the maximum number, and the probabilty of mutation.

Parameters:
config - the NeatParameters defining the environment in which this operation is performed.
maximum - the maximum value to be returned.
Returns:
that determines how many of the MutationOperation should be performed given the maximum number, and the probabilty of mutation.
